sentences.en: a grilled pork/lamb chop
sentences.cn: 烤猪排/羊排

sentences.en: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.cn: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

sentences.en: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.cn: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.en: Chop the carrots up into small pieces.
sentences.cn: 把胡萝卜切成小块。

sentences.en: Chop the celery and add it to the salad.
sentences.cn: 把芹菜切碎放到色拉.

sentences.en: Chop the ingredients finely and mix them together.
sentences.cn: 把原料细细剁碎后和在一起。

sentences.en: Chop the mushrooms and quarter the tomatoes.
sentences.cn: 把蘑菇切成丁，再把西红柿切成四瓣。

sentences.en: Chop the onions finely.
sentences.cn: 把洋葱切细。

sentences.en: Chop up three firm tomatoes.
sentences.cn: 拿3个硬西红柿切碎。

sentences.en: He struck off the branch with a single chop of the ax.
sentences.cn: 他一斧子就砍掉了那根树枝.

sentences.en: He then descends to chop suey.
sentences.cn: 然后他大口地吃起炒杂碎来.

sentences.en: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.cn: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.en: He won't say which programmes are for the chop.
sentences.cn: 他不愿说哪些项目将被毙掉。

sentences.en: hundreds more workers have been given the chop.
sentences.cn: 又有几百名工人被解雇。

sentences.en: I was both disappointed and amazed when I got the chop from the Wales team.
sentences.cn: 我被威尔士队解聘时，既失望又错愕。

sentences.en: Roughly chop the tomatoes and add them to the casserole.
sentences.cn: 把西红柿大致切一切，然后放到炖锅里。

sentences.en: She cut down the seedling with one chop.
sentences.cn: 她一刀就把小苗砍倒了.

sentences.en: Sometimes they have to chop down a tree for firewood.
sentences.cn: 他们有时只好砍树当柴烧。

sentences.en: that veranda's not much chop in bad weather.
sentences.cn: 天气不好时，那阳台就不令人满意了。

sentences.en: The purpose of the edit is fairly simple—to chop out the boring bits from the original.
sentences.cn: 编辑的目的非常简单——删掉原稿中那些无用的部分。

sentences.en: We had to chop a way through the undergrowth.
sentences.cn: 我们必须在矮树林中砍伐出一条路来.

words.tran_cn: [电子] 斩波器；斧头；切碎机

phrases.tran_cn: 学究般令人厌烦地争辩；诡辩
(非正式，主 澳／新西兰)令人不满的，不行的

trans.tran_en: a small piece of meat on a bone, usually cut from a sheep or pig
to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces
